triples.name: Microbiome
triples.relevance: The paper's central subject is how microbiomes shape host traits and evolutionary potential.

triples.name: Quantitative genetics
triples.relevance: The paper integrates quantitative genetics frameworks to model host-microbiome coevolution.

triples.name: Phenotype
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes how microbiomes affect host phenotypic variation and response to selection.

triples.name: Natural selection
triples.relevance: The paper discusses host response to selection, a key outcome of natural selection in populations.

triples.name: Evolutionary biology
triples.relevance: The paper addresses fundamental questions in evolutionary biology about how organisms evolve with their microbial partners.

triples.name: Symbiosis
triples.relevance: Host-microbiome relationships exemplify symbiotic interactions central to the paper's evolutionary framework.

triples.name: Heritability
triples.relevance: The paper uses heritability concepts to quantify how microbiomes affect the genetic basis of host trait variation.
